section.heading: Declaration in case of challenge of voter

content.p:
ยง 2019. Declaration in case of challenge of voter. If a person
offering to vote at any school district meeting or election shall be
challenged as unqualified, by any legal voter in such district, either
at such meeting or election, or by the filing of a challenge pursuant to
section two thousand fifteen of this chapter, the chairman presiding at
such meeting or election shall require the person so offering, to make
the following declaration: "I do declare and affirm that I am, and have
been, for the thirty days last past, an actual resident of this school
district and that I am qualified to vote at this meeting." Every person
making such declaration shall be permitted to vote on all questions
proposed at such meeting or election; but if any person shall refuse to
make such declaration, his vote shall be rejected.
